addressleaf.section: To the right honorable my very singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

7 Ap
r
1593 M
r
Bodeley to my L.

page.lettertext:
fol.86r
Maye it please yo
r
good L. I have sent yow heer-
inclosed a most impudent and railing libell,
against her
Ma
tie
,
yo
r
L., and
e state at home
in general. It was sent from
Liege
to
Mons
r
Buzenval
, who delivered it to me. Of
e Autor,
and
e place in w
ch
it was printed, there was
nothing written to him: but I am told of a l
re
,
wherein it is signified, to a gentleman heere,
at
it was made by
Cardinal Allen
, and printed
at
Collen,
by order of
e Popes
Nuntio:
who sent
a great number to
Frankford
mart. I knowe
yo
r
L. will reade it w
t
at contempt,
at it deserveth,
and every good man wheresoever, will repute it
an unfallible argument,
at he against whome
e
Enemie spurneth most, is he by whose endevo
rs
they are most impeached in their actions. In
that respect
e more they doe malice yo
r
procee-
dinges,
e more we are assured
at
e causes of
e
Churche of God, and
e affaires of her Ma
tie
are
prosperously maneged. W
ch
God graunt yo
w
may continue, for many yeres heereafter, w
t
like
succese as heeretofore.
And so I take my humble
leave. From
e Hage. A
p
7 1593.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
